sen.j: 刪定律令（さんていりつりょう）は、神護景雲3年（769年）に、右大臣吉備真備や大和長岡らによって編纂された律令法。
sen.e: Santei Ritsuryo Code was a ritsuryo code compiled by Minister of the Right, KIBI no Makibi, YAMATO no Nagaoka and so on in 769.

sen.e: It was enforced on April 13, 791 during the reign of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: 続いて延暦16年（797年）頃には、更に大納言神王・右中弁橘入居らによって刪定令格（さんていりょうかく）全45条が編纂され、同年6月9日 (旧暦)（797年7月7日）に施行された。
sen.e: Subsequently around 797, Santei Ryokaku Code with 45 articles was compiled by Major Counselor, Miwao, Middle Controller of the Right, TACHIBANA no Irii and so on and was enforced on July 7, 797.

sen.j: いずれも養老律令の欠陥を補うことを目的としたが、弘仁3年5月26日 (旧暦)（812年7月8日）には訴訟の頻発など民心の不安定を招くとして刪定律令の施行が停止された。
sen.e: Both were edited to fix the flaws in Yoro ritsuryo code, however, on July 8, 812, the enforcement of Santei Ritsuryo Code was suspended and although the order for amendment was issued because it was thought to provoke the public to feel insecurity causing many lawsuits to be filed, the amendment wasn't enforced after that and Santei Ritsuyo Code was practically abolished.

sen.j: 刪定令格については不明なものの、この停止を伝える『日本後紀』原文には「刪定令」とされており、刪定令格に関する記述も見られなくなる。
sen.e: Although what was done with Santei Ryokaku Code was not clear, the original text in "Nihonkoki" (Later Chronicle of Japan) referred to this suspension as 'Santei Ryo' and the description of Santei Ryokaku Code no longer appeared after that, so it is possible that the enforcement of Santei Ryokaku Code was also suspended at the same time, but when it was suspended or abolished is not clear.

sen.e: After that, Ritsuryo law wasn't compiled in Japan, and the flaws in the codes were fixed with Kyakushiki (supplementary provision) instead.
